#Text=Eastern Cibao
#Text=Eastern Cibao is a region of Dominican Republic .
#Text=Cities
#Text=Other destinations
#Text=Understand
#Text=The Province of Samaná has its own very distinct history and culture .
#Text=Until the early 20th century , this peninsula was an island separate from Hispaniola .

#Text=During Haiti 's occupation of Santo Domingo in the 19th century , freed slaves were brought here from the United States prior to the Civil War , and they kept their distinct protestant religion , gospel singing and the English language up to this date , when their descendants are known as the " Cocolos " .
#Text=Today , Samaná remains a melting-pot of cultures , as a great quantity of Europeans -- particularly French and Italians -- have settled in the towns of Las Terrenas and Las Galeras .
#Text=Las Terrenas remains a very bohemian town , very popular among Dominicans and foreigners alike .
#Text=Its beaches are lined with restaurants right by the sea , offering different European and local cuisines made by foreign settlers .
#Text=Las Terrenas also offers a distinctly nice nightlife , although increasingly plagued by prostitution .
#Text=Close to the town of Las Terrenas are the two beaches of Playa Bonita and Playa Cosón , separated by Punta Bonita .
#Text=While Playa Bonita offers more excitement with its higher and stronger waves , Playa Cosón faces beautiful mountains which make for a unique , beautiful scenery .
#Text=The more adventurous tourists can explore the waterfalls of the " Salto del Limón " , surrounded by tropical mountains and rainforests .
#Text=Las Galeras follows Las Terrenas as the region 's second most popular beach town .

#Text=Smaller and cozier , it has its own beautiful beach , where fishermen bring seafood directly from the sea , and tourists can eat fried fish , grilled shrimps and lobsters at a very low cost right on the beach .
#Text=The beaches of Playa Rincón and Playa Frontón are easily accessible by boat from Las Galeras .
#Text=Playa Rincón has been rated as one of the world 's three more beautiful beaches , and is said to have been Columbus 's point of entry into Hispaniola .
#Text=He himself is supposed to have described it as an earthly paradise .
#Text=This beach is not to be missed , and the restaurants on the beach offer an exquisite Dominican-style fried fish .
#Text=The actual town of Santa Barbara de Samana , the province 's capital , has recently gotten a face-lift .
#Text=It is one of the country 's most beautiful towns , and the small island of Cayo Levantado is easily accessible from it .
#Text=In the middle of the Samaná Bay , Cayo Levantado has beautiful beaches and its own five-star hotel .
#Text=Boats for whale watching also depart from the town of Samaná , as whales spend their winters in the bay 's warm waters .

#Text=Moreover , Los Haitises National Park is also readily accessible by boat from the town , displaying beautiful rain-forests and unending chains of jaw-dropping archipelagos that are easily explorable by boat .
#Text=Outside Samaná , the towns of Nagua and Sanchez offer their own distinct foods .
#Text=Sanchez is famous for its delicious shrimps , while Nagua is popular for its Dominican-style crab .
#Text=Although Nagua has not been developed by tourism , its unending sea of coconut trees offer very interesting exploration opportunities for the most adventurous tourists .
#Text=Do
#Text=Whale-Watching
#Text=The Samaná Bay offers unique opportunities for whale-watching during the Winter months .
